required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: 3D Printed Silicone Coronary Artery Simulator for Percutaneous Coronary Interventional Training
clinical_study.official_title: 3D Printed Silicone Coronary Artery Simulator for Percutaneous Coronary Interventional Training

lead_sponsor.agency: China National Center for Cardiovascular Diseases

clinical_study.source: China National Center for Cardiovascular Diseases

brief_summary.textblock: This study is aim to evaluate the feasibility and effectiveness of 3D printed silicone coronary artery simulator for percutaneous coronary interventional training.

detailed_description.textblock: With the aging of the population, the incidence of cardiovascular diseases has exceeded that of respiratory diseases and cancer, corresponding to the rapid increase in the number of coronary stent implantation. Therefore, the standardized training of interventional cardiologists is particularly important. Nowadays percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI) training mode is mainly for the trainees to operate on the patients under the experienced operator. Although this kind of training method can truly show the operation process, it has obvious limitations. For beginners, it takes repeated training and revision to achieve proficiency and accuracy.Learning only through real surgery may result in longer operative times, increased radiation exposure, and increased complications.This study is aim to evaluate the feasibility and effectiveness of 3D printed silicone coronary artery simulator for percutaneous coronary interventional training.

primary_outcome.measure: Change of the time taken in operation
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 4 hours
primary_outcome.description: The change of time taken to complete the coronary angiography assessment before and after training

primary_outcome.measure: Change of the amount of contrast agent used
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 4 hours
primary_outcome.description: The change of the amount of contrast agent used in the coronary angiography assessment before and after training

primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 4 hours
primary_outcome.description: The change of scores of "Rating scale of coronary angiography operation assessment" before and after training. The assessment includes operation integrity, standardization, proficiency, accuracy,etc. Every point contain 5 different levels from the worst(1) to the best(5).

arm_group.description: The participant who has completed the number of PCI less than 200 before recruiting
The participant who has completed the number of PCI more than 200 before recruiting

intervention.intervention_name: Training on coronary angiography using 3D coronary artery simulator
intervention.description: Participants will have a test of coronary arteriography before and after training, compare the scores to analysis if the simulator training is effective.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Previous experience in coronary intervention
- Understand the process of trail and be willing to participate
Exclusion Criteria:
- No previous experience with coronary intervention
- Unwilling to participate the trail
- Unable to complete the trail due to other problems

patient_data.ipd_description: including the simulator details; the basic information of all participants; the scores of all participants before and after training; the training process
